meanings.definition: A mass of snow piled up by the wind.
meanings.sent1: The children played in the soft snowdrifts.
meanings.sent2: After the blizzard, the road was blocked by huge snowdrifts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog buried his bone in the snowdrifts.
meanings.sent4: The snowdrifts resembled fluffy pillows along the street.
meanings.sent5: The snowdrifts sparkled like diamonds under the winter sun.

meanings.definition: To accumulate in a mound or heap.
meanings.sent1: We watched the snowdrifts forming outside our window.
meanings.sent2: If you don't shovel, the snow will snowdrifts in the driveway.
meanings.sent3: I tend to snowdrifts my laundry until it's a huge pile.
meanings.sent4: The leaves snowdrifts in the corner of the yard.
meanings.sent5: Her toys always snowdrifts in her room, creating a mess.
